result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Larry S Kollmann was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 100 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes: Fine is to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision (can be taken out of prison wages/trust accounts).

DNA surcharge and Blood draw fee are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision (can be taken out of prison wages/trust accounts).  Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt:
Character Letter, received and filed in court.
To be Sealed per Judge Lee S. Dreyfus.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Larry S Kollmann in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski.   

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following.  
Total Prison:  4.5 Years.
Initial Confinement: 1.5 Years.
Extended Supervision: 3 Years.
100 Days Credit.

36 Months D/L REVOCATION
36 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
DNA sample to be provided.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 (to be forward to the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department);
Fine:  $2,277
DNA Sample and Surcharge:   $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Bail to be Refunded.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence (can be taken out of prison wages/trust accounts).

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.


Defendant to be transferred to DCI.
